content.description: Morning Flakes is the main attraction on All-Bran Wall. Climb the obvious flake and edges that ascend the center of the wall.
content.protection: This climb is usually bouldered or toproped. Little or no meaningful protection can be found on the route.
content.location: Located in the center of All-Bran Wall. Marked by the large vertical flake.

content.description: Located far left side of All Bran Wall.  Nice mantel start and then follow the flake to the top.  In the morning it's in the shade.

All-Bran Wall is a 40' slabby wall with easy top rope access. There are several established problems on the wall and many variations are possible. Mostly ranging from 5-easy to 5.8. This wall is sometimes used as a place to bring novice climbers. Soloists and boulderers also pass through the area from time to time. 

  For the most part the rock quality is good, but there is some choss higher up. Accordingly, many of the cracks availble at the top are poorly suited for anchoring top ropes. However, there are several large features that can be used as top rope anchors. Take huge slings. There are no bolts or fixed anchors.
